user_provided_info.hobby_title:: <STRING: title of the hobby that this routine is built for>
goals: <list of STRINGs: the user's primary goals associated with this hobby>
user_provided_info.target_end_date: <STRING: mm-dd-yyyy format, target end date to achieve goals by>
user_provided_info.weekly_frequency: <INT: how many days per week the user wants to attribute to this hobby>
user_provided_info.min_intraday_frequency: <INT: for any given day that the user dedicates some amount of time to this hobby, this number represents the MINIMUM number of time blocks they should have within the day>
user_provided_info.max_intraday_frequency: <INT: for any given day that the user dedicates some amount of time to this hobby, this number represents the MAXIMUM number of time blocks they should have within the day>
user_provided_info.prefers_time_blocks: <BOOL: true indicates that the user wants specific time blocks generated for each day's tasks, false indicates that they don't want time blocks generated for each day's tasks>
user_provided_info.min_hours_per_week: <INT: represents the MINIMUM total hours per week that the user wants to dedicate to this hobby>
user_provided_info.max_hours_per_week: <INT: represents the MAXIMUM total hours per week that the user wants to dedicate to this hobby>

week_1.start_date: <STRING: mm-dd-yyyy format, the date for Monday of week 1>
week_1.end_date: <STRING: mm-dd-yyyy format, the date for Sunday of week 1>
weekly_tasks: <this list is always empty in this specific JSON format / context>

day_1.date: <STRING: mm-dd-yyyy format, the date the first day's tasks>
time_blocks: <list of STRINGs: each string formatted start_time-end_time (e.g. 10:30AM-01:30PM) - can be an empty list if the user doesn't want specific time blocks
tasks: <list of STRINGs: each string represents a specific task that the user must complete by the end of the corresponding day>
